reviews.title: Fantastic in every way

reviews.text: The bedroom was spacious with a huge, comfortable bed and great complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate facilities. Bathroom was spotlessly clean and also spacious and the breakfast was absolutely delicious. Terry, the host even made me some special gluten free muesli and had gluten free bread available.
reviews.title: A dark sky place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely, welcoming environment on the doorstep of one of the most beautiful places in the UK
reviews.title: First-class hospitality!
Lovely place to stay!
reviews.text: This is a lovely place to stay. We stayed here to visit the Observatory and to have some time in the Forest. The host is friendly and knowledgeable, and the room was good. We slept very well in the comfortable beds and the bathroom was very clean. Everything was done to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable even when the whole area was without power for a couple of days due to storms. A place we will go back to.

Stayed a night at Twenty Seven recently as part of a mini-tour of England and Scotland. We were to spend an evening at the Observatory and found this B&B to be perfectly located for coming back to afterward. Couldn't fault the room at all: well decorated with a really comfy bed and outstanding bathroom, all spotlessly clean. Terry was a fantastic host with lots of local information and ideas for further in our trip. Breakfast was also second to none, cooked to order with plenty of hot and cold options. With so much to do around Kielder apart from the observatory, we would definately return!
reviews.title: Everything you could want from a B&B

description: Dark Sky friendly accommodation in Kielder Water & Forest Park.Twenty Seven B&B - run by wife & husband team Jill & Terry Gregg is your place to stay when exploring Kielder - stay B&B all year roundLocated in Kielder village - England's most remote village - we are an ideal venue to view the dark skies. Great for all outdoor activities.As the most tranquil place in England, the vast Kielder Water & Forest Park is an amazing oasis where adventure and stunning scenery combine in a landscape rarely seen in England. With a 27 mile shoreline, Kielder Water is the largest man-made lake in Northern Europe and Kielder Forest, the largest planted forest in Northern Europe which means there is plenty to experience and enjoy.Twenty Seven B&B is actively supporting the application by KW&FP and NNPA for Dark Sky Park & Reserve Status for the area.Kielder is a great arena for outdoor pursuits with plenty of fresh air and clean spring water. If you are into walking, orienteering, running, cycling, mountaineering, climbing, hunting and fishing, then Kielder is the place to visit. Nearby attractions for the less active include Kielder Castle Forestry Visitor Centre, Kielder Salmon Hatchery tours, the brand new Kielder Observatory for the best dark skies in England, Kielder Birds of Prey Centre, NWL Visitor Centre and Kielder Arts and Architecture. Twenty Seven is an ideal base to explore further afield: Alnwick Gardens & Castle (1.5 hr); Hadrian's Wall forts and path (45 mins); Northumberland coast and castles (2 hr) and Scottish border towns (45 mins).We do home cooked, fresh food for Breakfast (meaty, pescy & veggie), packed lunches for your day out or onward journey, afternoon teas and evening meals ( this can be timed so you guarantee getting to events - especially Kielder Observatory - on time )After a busy day you will receive a warm welcome where you will find a comfortable conservatory to lounge in. All rooms come complete with complimentary tea and coffee making facilities, towels and toiletries, TV withe FreeSat.Locally we have : "the Anglers Arms" only 5 minutes walk away, Kielder Village Store only 30 seconds walk away and Kielder Cycle Centre only 9 minutes walk away.
